intro: Pedicularis surrecta, commonly known as the upright monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to red. Pedicularis surrecta thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and rocky slopes.
